item.title: Quiet, Always-On: How Development and Test Clusters Accumulate Energy Use
item.description: Production cluster systems are the most important since they serve customers. Most of the production clusters are overprovisioned with a “just in case” reason.

item.title: From Climate Science to Virtual Cloud Systems : Designing Green Cloud Systems
item.description: Introduction Before I was involved with cloud infrastructure and distributed systems, I spent years studying the climate. I am a doctor by PhD — in climate science — and I have spent years understanding how Earth’s climate systems behave, how energy moves through the atmosphere and oceans, and how small imbalances accumulate into large, sometimes irreversible changes.

item.title: Kubernetes Disaster Recovery: Lessons from Natural Disasters
item.description: Introduction Living in Japan for several years as a climate scientist taught me profound lessons about resilience—not just in natural systems, but in how we design and operate technology infrastructure.

item.title: How to Set Up Kafka on Kubernetes
item.description: Introduction Apache Kafka is a powerful distributed event streaming platform. Running Kafka on Kubernetes allows you to leverage container orchestration for scalability and resilience.

item.title: Getting Started with CSI on Azure Kubernetes Service
item.description: Introduction The Container Storage Interface (CSI) is now the industry standard for connecting Kubernetes clusters to a variety of storage solutions.
